english: not see; be out of sight; disappear; gone

etymology.description: 不 (not) + 见 (see) = not see; be out of sight; disappear; gone
etymology.interpretation: Negates the act of seeing to indicate something is out of sight, unseen, or has disappeared. Often appears as 不见了 to mean something is missing/gone.
etymology.simplification: 见 is the simplified form of 見, reduced for fewer strokes in a high-frequency graph; 不 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我手机不见了(我手機不見了)。
前面起雾(前面起霧)，他的人影很快不见了(他的人影很快不見了)。
examples.pinyin: Qiánmiàn qǐ wù, tā de rényǐng hěn kuài bújiàn le.
examples.english: Fog rose ahead, and his figure quickly disappeared.

examples.chinese: 灯太亮(燈太亮)，我看不见星星(我看不見星星)。
examples.pinyin: Dēng tài liàng, wǒ kàn bújiàn xīngxing.
examples.english: The light is too bright; I can’t see the stars.
